message: Metakgp shared a post. TL;DR Elastic Is Coming! ElasticSearch by Elastic is the most buzzing tech in the search industry, and hence, we stopped to ask each other at Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS, "What Is Elastic Search? And What Are We Cooking?" And also why Google says, "Use ElasticSearch, not Google Site Search"?

TLDR; Endsem is coming!

Metakgp shared a post. Greetings Freshers, All the programming enthusiasts, gear up for our introductory Seminar and join us for taking you through a tour into the world of Open Source. It's the time of the year when we look for people enthusiastic about spreading the Free and Open Source Software Movement. Here's your chance to know about our vision, what we do throughout the year and grab some goodies while you are at it. See you all there! Date - 7 February, Thursday Time - 7 PM Venue - Vikramshila V4

Happy New Year everyone :D. We wish you luck for your semester ahead. You may refer to the respective course pages on the wiki to see whats awaiting you.
Metakgp wiki (https://wiki.metakgp.org) is a community driven wiki being driven by the students of IIT Kharagpur. The sole aim for the wiki is to record the knowledge and experiences of students. It will be very helpful if you contribute to the wiki pages for the courses you had the previous semesters giving the fundae and the heads up for the batch succeeding you. 
You may also, give ratings for the professors at https://ratemyprof.defcon007.com

Metakgp shared Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS's post. Hey there, Just like every year, this weekend, KOSS is going to organise Python Programming classes. Python is a general-purpose language, which means it can be used to build just about anything. Python helps you to work in various fields such as - Data Mining, Machine Learning, Data Analysis, Web Development and more seamlessly. These programming classes can be stepping stones for students who want to pursue a career in Software Development or Data Science. The classes are going to be conducted on 1st and 2nd of September '18 (Saturday and Sunday). Event details are as follow - Venue: Nalanda NC-231 Date: 1st-2nd Sep 2018 Time: From 3 PM Register at - http://bit.ly/kosspc18 Make sure you bring your laptop with you. Also, it would be great if you have Python pre-installed. Download python from - https://www.python.org/downloads/ (3.x versions) If you are new to programming, don't worry we have got that covered for you.

On March 18, 2018, during the KGP Developers Meet, we spoke for 10 minutes about the advantages of having a developer friendly ERP. As the election season is currently underway, we would like to express our desire to work with the future VP to implement this project. We are sharing the proposal document that we have written, along with the section of the video that pertains to this topic.

Talk: https://youtu.be/fI6FQjFzAco?t=1300

Hello KGP!

Midsems are around the corner, which means it's officially time to scramble for past papers again! Skip the pain of having to go through the mundane directory listing on the library site and instead go to https://qp.metakgp.org/ for a cute little search engine that indexes all papers in the library site, along with a community contributed collection that we maintain.

Last semester, you contributed 250 papers to MFQP, taking the total number of papers provided by MFQP to 6775! Let's continue the streak this exam session!

Contribute papers by sending a scanned pdf of your question papers from this exam session to metakgp-qp@googlegroups.com and we will add it to our list. This is all we need as your token of appreciation.

Best of luck with your exams!

TL; DR: Do you know if your department has a lift/ramp/handicapped toilet? Help us make this information widely available for your fellow students.

Greetings KGP!
National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) recently published their yearly rankings for 2017 of educational institutions in India, in which IIT Kharagpur was placed 4th in the overall rankings.

One of the parameters used by NIRF for ranking is 'Facilities for Physically Challenged Students' which asks the following questions:
1. Does your institution have Lifts/Ramps?
2. Does your institution have provision for walking aids, including wheelchairs and transportation from one building to another for handicapped students?
3. Does your institution have specially designed toilets for handicapped students?

We believe this information isn't immediately accessible to the students as well as the administration currently and would like your help gathering it. Please take a minute and help us by editing the relevant Wiki page here:
https://wiki.metakgp.org/w/Facilities_for_Physically_Challenged_Students

Hey KGP!
The time for downloading our endsem admit cards is here. Alas, we cannot do the same without filling a feedback form. Most of us would love to do it, if we could read responses for the courses we fill too, rather than only an accolade by the director. 

So we have gone ahead and created a course page for every course that IIT KGP offers out there. But we'd like your help in adding a review for the course. Please add a small summary for your course you have taken this semester and help enlighten the rest of us. Popular optional courses such as electives, will be shared by us for Spring 2018 registrations to help you all out. 

https://goo.gl/forms/HmuVknW1DqFAA8EG2

Come by, say hello and hangout with us at metakgp.slack.com.

Kharagpur Winter of Code has been announced for one more time. Started last year, it is a program to introduce new students to free and open-source softwares. This has also helps college students prepare for Google Summer of Code, to be held in March.

For mentors : Do you maintain project(s) which needs students' contribution? Or are you a collaborator of any open source software? Let us together introduce more students to the world of open source ! Register your projects on https://kwoc.kossiitkgp.in

For students : Student registrations will start soon. Please stay tuned with Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS

https://wiki.metakgp.org/w/Kharagpur_Winter_of_Code

Greetings KGP! After the recent elections at Metakgp, we have chosen Kaustubh Hiware as our new maintainer. Please welcome him into leading the team to achieve a more collaborative and informative KGP! 

Details about the election process, other candidates, relevant dates and the detailed results can be found on the Wiki: https://wiki.metakgp.org/w/Metakgp:Governance/Election_October_2017

Come by, say hello and hangout with us at metakgp.slack.com.

With one more day to go in the present exam session, we hope you have had a good run. You can send your question paper to us, and we will upload it to MFQP. From now, until eternity, no one has to go into an exam hall clueless about what the questions will look like. Let's get together to make this a reality! Email images or a PDF of your question papers to metakgp-qp@googlegroups.com

MFQP: https://qp.metakgp.org

P.S. It really helps if you can use the CamScanner app and send us a PDF generated by that app. We appreciate the time and effort you put into this :)

Metakgp shared Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS's post. Whenever Apple releases a new version of the IPhone, a vast majority of users will flock to buy the current version, although previous versions are still well in use. This particular trend is observable in may real-life scenarios , recent publications are able to improve upon previously done work and hence relay in more citations, recent supreme court cases become famous because laws evolve and change with time. This dynamic evolution of networks is presented wonderfully in this video. Do give it a watch. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fhGewF4Xyo0&feature=youtu.be

Naresh Ramesh, Athitya Kumar, Rameshwar Bhaskaran and Ayush Goyal from Metakgp, recently represented IIT Kharagpur in the Dashboard event of the 5th Inter-IIT Tech Meet, and won the Bronze medal. The Dashboard built, is being fine-tuned and will be released soon for usage. 

We'd like to congratulate the team for winning Bronze. For the attention of fellow developers, you can have a look at the Dashboard code here : https://github.com/ghostwriternr/dashboard-beta

Election results are here:

1. Naresh Ramesh : (Condorcet winner:  wins contests with all other choices)
2. Nishant Nikhil : loses to Naresh R by 19–9
3. Ayush Goyal : loses to Naresh R by 18–10, loses to Nishant Nikhil by 14–13
4. Arun Patro : loses to Naresh R by 18–7, loses to Ayush Goyal by 16–11
5. Pranit Bauva : loses to Naresh R by 20–6, loses to Arun Patro by 15–12
6. Rameshwar Bhaskaran : loses to Naresh R by 22–3, loses to Pranit Bauva by 18–8
7. Sayan Sinha : loses to Naresh R by 22–3, loses to Rameshwar Bhaskaran by 14–9

29 out of 126 eligible voters casted their votes. The top three candidates,
Naresh R, Nishant Nikhil and Ayush Goyal will be maintainers of metakgp for
next one year, eight months and four months respectively.

Congratulations to new maintainers, we hope that metakgp will reach new heights under their leadership. Thanks a lot to all candidates who took out their precious time to participate in the election process.

BTW as a reminder to everyone, not being a maintainer doesn't stop you from taking initiatives. Metakgp is an open community, you can start your own projects, improve existing ones and make metakgp more awesome.

Please submit any (anonymous) feedback you might have about the election using this form https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScgOaX0EET1HFJkGD3I3mqD0tTnQ3qRMu2UuOIOa7ECHorY_w/viewform
 and of course if you want to discuss something or just hangout with us, you can join us on our slack channel http://metakgp-slack.herokuapp.com/

Congratulations to new maintainers, we hope that metakgp will reach new heights under their leadership. Thanks a lot to all candidates who took out their precious time to participate in the election process.

BTW as a reminder to everyone, not being a maintainer doesn't stop you from taking initiatives. Metakgp is an open community, you can start your own projects, improve existing ones and make metakgp more awesome.

Please submit any (anonymous) feedback you might have about the election using this form https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScgOaX0EET1HFJkGD3I3mqD0tTnQ3qRMu2UuOIOa7ECHorY_w/viewform
 and of course if you want to discuss something or just hangout with us, you can join us on our slack channel http://metakgp-slack.herokuapp.com/

Folks,
The date of election is here. We have seven candidates who are contesting for three posts of maintainers. The maintainers will play a key role in deciding what you see in near future from MetaKGP. You can learn about them and read their proposals here https://wiki.metakgp.org/w/Metakgp:Governance/Election_March_2017#Candidates

You can add your comments on wiki or interact with the candidates on the slack channel (http://metakgp-slack.herokuapp.com/).

The voting starts from 00:00 Tuesday (mid-night tonight) and will end on 23:59 Tuesday (mid-night tomorrow). If got an email for the mock poll, you'll also get an email with the voting link when the voting starts.

We hope you'll help us elect the most suitable candidates.

Folks,
We are having election at metakgp to choose our maintainers.  Anyone including first years can contest and anyone one who has contributed to the wiki or any of our projects is allowed to vote. Please see the doc for details (https://paper.dropbox.com/doc/Election-RfYYiokn1X6mHcXwJ62BR).

We are having a mock poll today to give a feel of the election platform and process. If you have contributed, you must have received an email with the voting link. If you have contributed and not received an email please let us know by writing to mail@hargup.in or on our slack channel (http://metakgp-slack.herokuapp.com/).

Metakgp shared Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS's photo. Yes, it is that time of the year again when you have to convert coffee to code. I hope you all know that Google Summer of Code is approaching soon and the Selected Organization list is going to be published on coming Monday. Therefore, we are planning to conduct a seminar on how to overcome the initial barrier and we will also provide you a lot of insights about GSoC program by people who have cracked GSoC before as students and as mentors. The mentors will provide you even better insights of how they select students and much more stuff. Thus we hope to see you for the GSoC seminar on Monday, 27th February 2017 at 6.30pm Vikramshila V4. Cheers!

Book Club Meeting!

The book club is meeting tonight at 9 pm in the Library Annexe building (exact location not yet fixed). We will meet at the Annexe building end of the tunnel connecting the two buildings, and proceed from there.

Looking for a recommendation to start reading books? Read a book that you want to talk about? Read a lot of books? Writing a book? Just want to check out what's going on? Drop by to the Library at 9 pm. We would love to hear from you!

Vivek Rai shared a post to Metakgp's Timeline. Hola folks! We've crossed 2000 likes - Thanks for your love. :-) As a token of thanks from our side, we'd like to announce our giveaway : The top 3 contributors to projects of Metakgp in Kharagpur Open Source Society's Kharagpur Winter of Code (KWoC) 2016, will be given a free Metakgp Hoodie each. This giveaway is applicable only for contributors who are from IIT Kharagpur, due to logistical reasons.

Ahoy, folks. It's that time of the year again. Our ammunitions have been designed, and you can order Metakgp's Tees & Hoodies. Fill up the sheets below -

For Hoodie : https://goo.gl/forms/29HWz6erfepmRw8z2
For Tee : https://goo.gl/forms/usWR50RyKfDFVqpK2

These sheets are available to be filled, till 17/11/16 midnight. 

P.S - Cost of individual Hoodie / Tee depends on the total quantity ordered, and will be communicated to all the buyers. However, the maximum price can be understood as Rs 749 for Hoodie, and Rs 499 for Tee.

P.P.S - Yes, payment has to be done before we place the order and No, we don't accept 500 , 1000 Rs notes.

Happy ordering, folks.

Sometimes a little help can take us way forward. Ankur Agarwal (placecom 2015-2016), Kunal Jain and Vivek Aithal compiled the best practices and resources from some the students who got job offers, in various sectors. Each section contains answers to the following questions by successful candidates.

1.    What was the general interview process for most companies of this sector? Please mention the number of rounds and the nature of the interview process.

2.    What are some of the FAQs that you faced and think students must definitely prepare for?

3.    What are things students can do from now until December to maximise their chances of getting through a company in this sector?

4.    List resources you found useful/necessary to be successful in interviews

        a. Must do resources [Compulsory reads]
        b. Advanced resources [They are not required for all companies, but will improve chances in top tier firms]
        c. Auxiliary read [They are not compulsory, but will definitely help]

https://wiki.metakgp.org/w/Placement_Interview_Experiences

Kudos to those fine citizens of the realm who have already contributed to the Paper Collection Drive! For those haven't contributed yet, we request you again to submit your mid-semester question papers - keeping in mind that even a single paper could help out a large batch of existing and future students - especially with the Library site going down regularly this time.

Here's how you can contribute - Click, Upload & Send.

(1) Take picture(s) of your question paper
(2) Visit http://metakgp.github.io/mfqp-source/ and click the upload button
(3) Attach your images in the mail, and send the mail.

Never go to an exam without having had a look at the previous year's paper! Let's all work together in order to achieve this goal.

Have a great week ahead. And awesome Durga Puja hols ahead of that. That's all folks!

Greetings, fine citizens of the realm! We hope your mid-semester exams went well.

As the library site was down for most part of mid-semester exams, our site MFQP was also rendered to be down for the first few days, but we found a way out so that we could keep serving papers to everyone in KGP! Now, let's all contribute, and increase the papers MFQP has. Our Paper Collection Drive starts today! We request everyone to submit their mid-semester question papers.

Here's how you can contribute - Click, Upload & Send.

1. Take a picture of your question paper
2. Write Subject Code in email
3. Send to metakgp-qp@googlegroups.com

And, do visit http://metakgp.github.io/mfqp-source/ 

Never go to an exam without having had a look at the previous year's paper! Let's all work towards achieving that goal.

That's all folks! Have a nice week ahead!

MFQP is working again. The library site for previous year papers has been down for most of this exam session, and since MFQP linked to the papers from there, the papers were not accessible. We have found a work-around now, and we are serving the papers from another file server. 

You can prepare productively with access to QPs again. (Note that this is an archive of papers from 2014, so papers from 2015 won't be available)

http://qp.metakgp.org/

Metakgp shared Kharagpur Open Source Society's photo. Time for the first event of this session! As they say, any good open source developer worth his (or her) salt uses Linux. As a part of introducing awareness about Open Source in the campus, KOSS, in association with Metakgp and IEEE Student Branch, IIT Kharagpur, is organising the Ubuntu Install Fest. Date: 4th September, Sunday Venue: Room 119 - CSE Department Time - 2 to 6 pm. Be there! Note: Please bring a pendrive along with your laptop, and ensure there is enough charge for the installation to complete smoothly. Written instructions: https://wiki.metakgp.org/w/How_to_install_Ubuntu_as_Dual_Boot

message:
Moving forward with our aim to curate information important to KGPians, we have started to collect "How To"s on metakgp. From guides about Institute formalities, like getting bonafide certificates and transcripts, to how-to's about travel and visas, our list goes on. The best thing is, metakgp is a wiki, this means **anyone** can edit it. So please add your own How To's to make things better.

https://wiki.metakgp.org/w/List_of_how-tos

We having a hackday tomorrow. In a hackday we come together and hack on something. **Absolutely everyone is invited**, it doesn't matter which year you are in, it doesn't matter whether you have been involved with metakgp or not and it doesn't matter if you know much programming or not. We believe everyone will have something to contribute and everyone will be able to learn something from the hackday. You can come with your own ideas or work with someone with the ideas listed below. The ideas need not be related to metaKGP or coding, for that matter.

Venue: Group Study Room, 2nd Floor Annex Building Central Library

Time: 1 PM to 8 PM

https://wiki.metakgp.org/w/Metakgp:Meetups/2016-08-07

Next in our list of featured articles is **Table Tennis**.

"Table Tennis is one of the 13 sports which is a part of the General Championship during Inter IIT Sports Meet. IIT Kharagpur has a separate building (generally referred to as the Old Gymkhana) dedicated to Table Tennis, just behind the Volleyball Court and beside Iosys. It has 4 Stag 1000 DX table tennis boards, and a matted floor."

https://wiki.metakgp.org/w/Table_Tennis
